#1.Creating a function
```{r}
add_numbers <- function(x, y) {

  # sum two values  
  result <- x + y      
  
  # print the result
  return(result)       
}

add_numbers(4, 6)

```

#2. Cleaning Text
```{r}
# function to clean  text
clean_text <- function(text) {
  
  # Convert all letters to lowercase
  text <- tolower(text)             
  
  # Remove numbers, punctuation, and symbols
  text <- gsub("[^a-z ]", " ", text) 
  
  # Replace extra spaces
  text <- gsub("\\s+", " ", text)    
  
  return(text)                      
}

clean_text("Hello!!! This is MESSY text 123")
```


#3. Split Text
```{r}
#string
sentence <- "mary had a little lamb"     

# Split the sentence
words <- strsplit(sentence, " ")         

 # Convert the list into a vector
words_vector <- unlist(words) 
 # Create a data frame with one word per row
data.frame(word = words_vector)         
```


#4. Counting Words (Tokens)
```{r}
# Create a vector of words
words <- c("this", "is", "a", "test", "this")  

# Count how many total words there are
total_words <- length(words)                   

 # Display the total word count
total_words                                  
```


#5. Typeâ€“Token Ratio (TTR)
```{r}
# Create a vector of words
words <- c("this", "is", "a", "test", "this")  

# Find the unique words (types)
unique_words <- unique(words)   

# Count the number of unique words
num_unique <- length(unique_words)            

# Count the total number of words
num_total <- length(words)                     

# Divide types by tokens to get TTR
ttr <- num_unique / num_total                  

# Display the Type-Token Ratio
ttr  
```

#6. Calculate Mean
```{r}
mymean <- function(numbers) {
# add all numbers
total <- sum(numbers)      

# how many numbers
count <- length(numbers)   
mean_value <- total / count
return(mean_value)
}

mymean(c(3, 9, 12, 6, 18))
```
